page.title: 09GOVERNMENT
page.content: The villages of Braceby & Sapperton and the surrounding land form the parish of Braceby and Sapperton. The western boundary is the Roman road "Long Hollow". The Parish has no council but is entitled to send a representative to form part of the Ropsley & District Parish Council. It is also possible to become a member of the Ropsley & Dist P.C by right as parishoners live within 3 miles of Ropsley. At present 2 people (1 man 1 woman) are on the P.C. The parish is part of the South Kesteven District and Lincolnshire County Council area, and for these is part of a larger electoral area. The parish is part of the Stamford and Spalding Constituency (until 1983 it was part of the Rutland & Stamford Const.) The M.P. is Sir Kenneth Lewis, a Conservative. Both District and County are Conservative.
